Library Version and Error Descriptions

Function Documentation

int rbxLib_getVersion (  int *  libVersion  ) 
 

Gets the version of the loaded Nexway library.

The version number can be determined by viewing the returned int as hexadecimal.

Examples:
  0x00010000 (hex) = 0.1.0.0 (ver)
  0x01020001 (hex) = 1.2.0.1 (ver)
  0x02110400 (hex) = 2.11.4.0 (ver)
Parameters:
[out] libVersion pointer to an int that receives the version
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes

int rbxLib_getErrMsg (  int  errCode,
char *  errMsg,
int  maxLen,
int *  retLen
) 
 

Gets a description of the specified Robix error code.

This function is useful when displaying error conditions. Rather than printing a cryptic error code, you can use this function to retrieve a description of the error.

Parameters:
[in] errCode Robix error code
[out] errMsg pointer to a user buffer that receives the string; or NULL to get the required buffer length
[in] maxLen length of user buffer
[out] retLen pointer to an int that receives the actual number of characters copied or the required buffer length (if user buffer is NULL);
this paramater can be NULL only if the user buffer is not NULL;
Returns:
generic Robix Error Codes
See also:
Fetching Strings
